entry.title: “Sensing an opportunity in this turbo-charged election,...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Sensing an opportunity in this turbo-charged election, progressives are pouring significant resources into their effort: The Sixteen Thirty Fund, a national dark money nonprofit, has given nearly $3 million to the campaign itself. But the ballot initiative could be a risk for reformers too: An election loss would make it more difficult to try again at the capitol.”

The Colorado Sun

Lawmakers have rejected it six times. Now, Proposition 118 could make Colorado the ninth state in the country to mandate paid family leave — or set the effort back even further.

cpr.org

After Years Of Statehouse Debate, Colorado Voters Face Historic Decision On Paid Family Leave

Lawmakers have rejected it six times. Now, Proposition 118 could make Colorado the ninth state in the country to mandate paid family leave — or set the effort back even further.Lawmakers have rejected it six times. Now, Proposition 118 could make Colorado the ninth state in the country to mandate paid family leave — or set the effort back even further.

entry.title: “The important thing when it comes to releasing is right, not...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The important thing when it comes to releasing is right, not fast,” Sarah Tuneberg, Polis’ coronavirus innovation response team lead, said in a written statement. “We want to make sure that everything is in place to make the launch as smooth and as seamless as possible.”

The Colorado Sun

State officials initially said the “Exposure Notifications Express” system would go live before the end of September

coloradosun.com

Coronavirus exposure-notification service for smartphones won’t be rolled out in Colorado until October

State officials initially said the “Exposure Notifications Express” system would go live before the end of SeptemberState officials initially said the “Exposure Notifications Express” system would go live before the end of September

entry.title: Last night, President Trump not only refused to denounce white...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Last night, President Trump not only refused to denounce white supremacy, but used the debate stage to put out a signal to “the Proud Boys”, a right-wing extremist group, to “stand back and stand by”. Stand by for what? Let’s be clear about one thing - this is a threat aimed at the American people. This should never be said by a president and never said on a debate stage. FOX21 News

entry.title: I am so honored to be named Emerge Colorado's trailblazer...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

I am so honored to be named Emerge Colorado's trailblazer of the year! Purchase your tickets today (https://rb.gy/oedvk7) and join us Thursday, October 15th, for the celebration.

Our annual Trailblazers Reception brings together supporters, our alumnae, elected officials, business leaders, and political professionals from across the state to celebrate women's political leadership in Colorado and look ahead to all that we will be able to accomplish in 2020 and beyond.

secure.everyaction.com

Emerge Colorado's 2020 Annual Trailblazers Reception

Our annual Trailblazers Reception brings together supporters, our alumnae, elected officials, business leaders, and political professionals from across the state to celebrate women's political leadership in Colorado and look ahead to all that we will be able to accomplish in 2020 and beyond.Our annual Trailblazers Reception brings together supporters, our alumnae, elected officials, business leaders, and political professionals from across the state to celebrate women's political leadership in Colorado and look ahead to all that we will be able to accomplish in 2020 and beyond.

entry.title: "A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters — especially younger ones — to cure, or fix, the problem, Griswold told The Denver Post. Voters will be notified of discrepancies by mail, as usual. But now they’ll have a route other than the U.S. Postal Service to fix the problem."

The Denver Post

A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters — especially younger ones — to cure, or fix, problematic ballots.

denverpost.com

Colorado voters will be able to fix their ballot problems via text, Secretary of State says

A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters — especially younger ones — to cure, or fix, problematic ballots.A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters — especially younger ones — to cure, or fix, problematic ballots.Visit the Voting Information Center for official election resources and local updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: “Denver Elections anticipates such a busy election, it went...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Denver Elections anticipates such a busy election, it went out and found new places for people to cast their ballot.

A release from Denver Elections on Tuesday said it will move operations from its main office vote center, on 14th Avenue, down a block to the McNichols Building in Civic Center Park “so that the entire Denver Elections building can be utilized for ballot processing.” The move was prompted as the office anticipates high voter turnout and because this year’s ballot includes three double-sided cards. The McNichols offices, at 144 W. Colfax Ave., will open Oct. 12.”

Denverite

For the first time ever, you’ll be able to cast a ballot at the Pepsi Center. The city will have 36 voting centers.

denverite.com

Denver Elections adds vote centers — including the Pepsi Center — as it anticipates high turnout

For the first time ever, you’ll be able to cast a ballot at the Pepsi Center. The city will have 36 voting centers.For the first time ever, you’ll be able to cast a ballot at the Pepsi Center. The city will have 36 voting centers.

entry.title: “Under the law, individuals convicted of felonies can vote as...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Under the law, individuals convicted of felonies can vote as soon as they are released from prison, even if they have not yet paid all their fines or restitution. This applies to those on parole, who must meet a series of conditions before completing their sentence.

“We are always intentional about letting people know their rights because incarceration has disproportionately impacted communities of color and particularly Black communities,” Lytle said. “

The Colorado Sun

The law allows those convicted of felonies who are out on parole to vote. People convicted of misdemeanors or awaiting trial have long been able to vote.

coloradosun.com

Colorado parolees are now allowed to vote. And advocates are rushing to register them.

The law allows those convicted of felonies who are out on parole to vote. People convicted of misdemeanors or awaiting trial have long been able to vote.The law allows those convicted of felonies who are out on parole to vote. People convicted of misdemeanors or awaiting trial have long been able to vote.

entry.title: “What’s so exciting about this moment is that we are...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“What’s so exciting about this moment is that we are recognizing that racism is indeed institutional and structural,” activist and scholar Angela Davis explained in a recent interview. “It is embedded in the very fabric of this country, and we’re trying to figure out ways to begin to initiate the process of eliminating that racism.” To understand just how deeply racism is embedded in our systems, all you have to do is examine any Black community.”

Essence

Leaders must commit to ensuring that the federal government proactively works to ensure all of its actions are anti-racist and produce equitable outcomes.

essence.com

To Overcome Structural Racism, We Must Create An Anti-Racist Government

Leaders must commit to ensuring that the federal government proactively works to ensure all of its actions are anti-racist and produce equitable outcomes.Leaders must commit to ensuring that the federal government proactively works to ensure all of its actions are anti-racist and produce equitable outcomes.

entry.title: “Cigarettes and tobacco products are taxed in Colorado. Vaping...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Cigarettes and tobacco products are taxed in Colorado. Vaping devices and vaping fuel are not.

A question on the November ballot — Proposition EE — would change that system, increasing the price of cigarettes and all other nicotine and tobacco products gradually over the next seven years”

The Colorado Sun

The ballot initiative would require cigarettes to be sold for no less than $7 starting in January. By July 2027, nicotine products would be taxed at 62% of their market list price.

coloradosun.com

Proposition EE explained: How much more cigarettes, nicotine products would cost in Colorado

The ballot initiative would require cigarettes to be sold for no less than $7 starting in January. By July 2027, nicotine products would be taxed at 62% of their market list price.The ballot initiative would require cigarettes to be sold for no less than $7 starting in January. By July 2027, nicotine products would be taxed at 62% of their market list price.

entry.title: “Gradually, however, the use of medication abortion has...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Gradually, however, the use of medication abortion has expanded. According to the most recent data, about 40% of all abortions in the United States are by this method. Some 17 states permit Advanced Practice Clinicians (nurse practitioners, midwives and physician assistants) to provide medication abortion, and this has particularly benefitted rural women. Simultaneously, however, from 2000 on, red state legislators have sought in numerous ways to restrict this method. Seventeen states, for example, prohibit the use of telehealth for medication abortion, though this has been very successful where allowed.”

TIME

Twenty years after it was approved in the U.S. medication abortion is finally becoming more widely used thanks to the COVID-19 pandemic.

time.com

A Rare Expansion in Abortion Access Because of COVID-19

Twenty years after it was approved in the U.S. medication abortion is finally becoming more widely used thanks to the COVID-19 pandemic.Twenty years after it was approved in the U.S. medication abortion is finally becoming more widely used thanks to the COVID-19 pandemic.

entry.title: “DPS has said that the earliest schools will resume in-person...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“DPS has said that the earliest schools will resume in-person learning is October 18, but as parents well know, the district’s projections keep changing. For many, returning to in-school learning is unlikely due to health concerns or fear about the district’s capacity to keep their children safe. For others, hope for face-to-face learning is mixed with anxiety as families await information on DPS protocols, class sizes, and other guidelines.”

What may be the long term implications of pods on public education? In the long term, could it lead to middle class and wealthier parents' divestment from public schools?

frontporchne.com

Getting by with pods—but what is the long term cost? | Front Porch

What may be the long term implications of pods on public education? In the long term, could it lead to middle class and wealthier parents' divestment from public schools?What may be the long term implications of pods on public education? In the long term, could it lead to middle class and wealthier parents' divestment from public schools?

entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Artists and volunteers in Denver started a community mural on Sunday in honor of the late-Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. History Colorado is inviting Coloradans to commemorate her legacy during the three-day event.”

Cbs4 denver

Artists and volunteers in Denver started a community mural on Sunday in honor of the late-Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Volunteers Invited To Honor Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg Outside History Colorado Museum

entry.title: “Almost half the US is reporting increased numbers of new...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Almost half the US is reporting increased numbers of new Covid-19 cases as health experts warn of a potential coronavirus surge in the fall and winter.

As of Sunday, the number of new coronavirus cases has increased by at least 10% or more compared to the week before in 21 states, most of them in the West, according to a CNN analysis of data from Johns Hopkins University.”

@cnn

Almost half the US is reporting increased numbers of new Covid-19 cases as health experts warn of a potential coronavirus surge in the fall and winter.

cnn.com

Twenty-one states are reporting increased Covid-19 cases as experts warn of a fall surge

entry.title: “The stresses of the pandemic — not only the health crisis...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The stresses of the pandemic — not only the health crisis and isolation but the economy and school closures — have exacerbated mental health issues in the area, Marriott said.

“It has created chaos in many people’s lives who don’t even suffer from a behavioral health issue,” she said. “When you look at people who were already struggling, it just adds fuel to fire.”

The Colorado Sun

Nine people have died by suicide so far this year, five in the past month in a region that has been fighting to expand mental health care and break down stigma around treatment

coloradosun.com

Wave of suicides in northwest Colorado part of “toxic stress” from coronavirus, experts say

Nine people have died by suicide so far this year, five in the past month in a region that has been fighting to expand mental health care and break down stigma around treatmentNine people have died by suicide so far this year, five in the past month in a region that has been fighting to expand mental health care and break down stigma around treatment

entry.title: “Barely a month into the school year, many Colorado teachers...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Barely a month into the school year, many Colorado teachers are at a breaking point as they try to balance new responsibilities like temperature checks, juggle classes of students both in person and online and manage dozens of kids over a screen.

The stress levels have gotten so high for some teachers that they’ve called a suicide hotline.

School districts need help, and they’re calling on the state to extend it.”

...

The Colorado Sun

See MoreThe start of school has been chaotic for districts amid the coronavirus crisis. Educators fear that without more support, students will be left behind.

coloradosun.com

“At a breaking point”: Colorado schools plead for help as stress of pandemic teaching piles up

The start of school has been chaotic for districts amid the coronavirus crisis. Educators fear that without more support, students will be left behind.The start of school has been chaotic for districts amid the coronavirus crisis. Educators fear that without more support, students will be left behind.

entry.title: “Colorado enacted the National Popular Vote (NPV) interstate...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Colorado enacted the National Popular Vote (NPV) interstate compact into law in March 2019. In November 2020, voters will see a question on the Colorado ballot asking if they choose to repeal this law. The NPV, when enacted by states with a total of 270 electoral votes, will ensure that the Electoral College vote will match the popular vote winner.”

Front Porch Newspaper

Long before he was a rapping, swaggering Broadway sensation, Alexander Hamilton was an unapologetic elitist. To be fair, Hamilton was not alone among the Founding Fathers in this regard. They created the Electoral College, with its electors as a buffer between the people and the president.

frontporchne.com

Will Voters Repeal Colorado’s National Popular Vote Law? | Front Porch

Long before he was a rapping, swaggering Broadway sensation, Alexander Hamilton was an unapologetic elitist. To be fair, Hamilton was not alone among the Founding Fathers in this regard. They created the Electoral College, with its electors as a buffer between the people and the president.Long before he was a rapping, swaggering Broadway sensation, Alexander Hamilton was an unapologetic elitist. To be fair, Hamilton was not alone among the Founding Fathers in this regard. They created the Electoral College, with its electors as a buffer between the people and the president.

entry.title: “So far, getting a full understanding of the mental and...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“So far, getting a full understanding of the mental and emotional toll of COVID-19 has been difficult, including gauging the effect it’s having on children and teens. But mental health professionals said they are starting to see more demand for counseling and in-patient hospital stays.”

Greeley Tribune

Teens were already stressed. Now the pandemic, an economic crisis, police violence, racial justice protests and the long shadow of systemic racism are starting to add up.

greeleytribune.com

Youth suicide rates during the pandemic foreshadow what experts say will be a “tsunami of need”

Teens were already stressed. Now the pandemic, an economic crisis, police violence, racial justice protests and the long shadow of systemic racism are starting to add up.Teens were already stressed. Now the pandemic, an economic crisis, police violence, racial justice protests and the long shadow of systemic racism are starting to add up.

entry.title: “Every 12 hours a woman dies due to complications resulting...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Every 12 hours a woman dies due to complications resulting from pregnancy. Additionally, 2 babies die each day. These numbers are disproportionately higher for moms and babies of color,” wrote Stacey D. Stewart, the group’s president and CEO, in the report. “Nothing sums up the state of the situation that we face in America as well as this one fact: In 2020 the U.S. remains among the most dangerous developed nations for a woman to give birth.”

Colorado Politics

Twenty-four counties in Colorado have no hospital offering obstetric care or no birth center , according to a new report on “maternity care deserts” across the country.

coloradopolitics.com

Report: 24 Colorado counties are "maternal care deserts"

Twenty-four counties in Colorado have no hospital offering obstetric care or no birth center , according to a new report on “maternity care deserts” across the country.Twenty-four counties in Colorado have no hospital offering obstetric care or no birth center , according to a new report on “maternity care deserts” across the country.

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine
